title: Approaches to change based on sentiments of fear
content: Fear is induced by the perception of a threat, leading to action to avoidance. Reactionary physiological mechanisms such as “flight, fight, freeze, fright, and faint” are triggered in order to face or to avoid confrontation. (Wikipedia contributors, 2020g) Today, a variety of approaches to change are based on mechanisms rooted in fear, manifesting itself through emotional modes of guilt, denial, anger or flight. This part consists of an itemised interrogation of popular approaches to change based on fear, in order to understand why they are not capable of enacting large-scale and sustainable change.
